toolInfo.name: COVID-19 Symptom Checker
toolInfo.description: Assessment tool for COVID-19 symptoms and risk factors

questions.question: Do you currently have a fever (temperature above 100.4°F/38°C)?
Are you experiencing a new or worsening cough?
Do you have shortness of breath or difficulty breathing?

options.text: Mild shortness of breath with activity

questions.question: Have you lost your sense of taste or smell?

options.text: Complete loss of taste or smell
Both taste and smell completely gone

questions.question: Are you experiencing fatigue or unusual tiredness?
Have you been in close contact with someone who tested positive for COVID-19 in the last 14 days?

options.text: Living with someone who tested positive

questions.question: Are you experiencing any gastrointestinal symptoms (nausea, vomiting, diarrhea)?

low.title: Low COVID-19 Risk
low.description: Based on your responses, you have a low likelihood of COVID-19. However, symptoms can develop gradually.
low.recommendations: Continue monitoring your health and follow preventive measures. If you develop new symptoms or your condition worsens, consider retaking this assessment or consulting a healthcare provider.
nextSteps: Continue wearing masks in crowded areas
Stay up to date with vaccinations
Contact healthcare provider if symptoms worsen
Consider testing if you've had known exposure

medium.title: Moderate COVID-19 Risk
medium.description: Your symptoms suggest a moderate possibility of COVID-19. Testing and medical evaluation are recommended.
medium.recommendations: You should get tested for COVID-19 and consider consulting with a healthcare provider. Isolate yourself from others until you receive test results and medical guidance.
nextSteps: Notify close contacts about potential exposure

high.title: High COVID-19 Risk
high.description: Your symptoms are highly suggestive of COVID-19, especially if you have severe breathing difficulties. Immediate medical attention may be needed.
high.recommendations: Seek immediate medical attention, especially if you have difficulty breathing. Get tested for COVID-19 and begin isolation immediately. If you have severe symptoms, contact emergency services.
nextSteps: Call emergency services if you have severe breathing problems
Get tested for COVID-19 as soon as possible
Follow all guidance from healthcare providers
